Description: Lower body and flaring foot sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black with circles in added red and added white; exterior: reserved at junction of foot and bowl; below, glazed (mostly fired red); reserved band around edge of foot. Underside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see the Mature Animal Style chalice from Pitane, now in the Istanbul Museum (Lemos 1991, no. 2267, pl. 87, no. 674).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0624) (phase 2)
